node.display_long_description:
Cast spells using the Shaman Sphere to invoke a wide range of weapons and fight your way through spectacularly looking galaxies to the beat of a French Touch soundtrack.

Hop from planet to solar system in a stunningly beautiful and procedurally generated universe where no playthrough is ever the same.

Fall, try again and unlock powerful new weapons and abilities to find your playstyle. Invoke them using a unique and ultra-satisfying motion-based spellcasting system that will soon make you feel invincible.

Battle armadas of deadly mechanical enemies until you reach epic boss fights that block your path to new solar systems. Along the way, you will meet a quirky roster of characters.

And don't forget to admire the finer details of the extraordinary life forms you're bringing back to life as you chase the corrupt Architects of Entropy to the most remote corners of their cubic universe.

For you are a STAR SHAMAN, a champion of biodiversity and the galaxy's last resort.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Greetings Shamans, 
We are delighted to share our first major update that we have been working on based on your feedback:

- Better player progression: you now unlock spells and items within your runs, and unlock permanent weapons and abilities in-between runs. Save three planets and you’ll be wielding the astral sword for the rest of your runs!
- 3 new spells: Beam (hold trigger to channel it towards enemies) Nova (fry hand-thrown grenade) and Jolt Daemon (a jolt-firing entity to fight alongside you for a limited time).
- Updated graphics with 15 new moons, in-game UI in a higher resolution.
- Revised and shortened tutorial.
- 90Hz mode on Quest 2.
- Quicker loading times.
- Italian, Spanish, Chinese and Japanese subtitled added

Stay safe, and see you on the Milky Way.

nodes.title: Major Update to Star Shaman
nodes.body_text:
Greetings Shaman

Here at Lunar Grove we have been circling the galaxy in preparation for your next voyage. We are incredibly grateful for all the initial feedback we received on the game. Please don’t stop sharing. We love hearing from you.

Today, Star Shaman 2.0 is released and with it comes some big changes.

A stronger sense of character progression. Weapons and perks now unlock in the Reliquary during the game instead of when you die. In addition, each time you die, perks and persistent spells will be added to your Shaman Sphere for your next run, giving you more strength for your return. Additionally, respawning now grants you more money.

In this update, we've managed to trade 3 new spells with the Kybele:
•    Beam: Hold trigger to channel it towards enemies.
•    Nova: Stun/Fry hand-thrown grenade.
•    Jolt Daemon: A jolt-firing entity to fight alongside you for a limited time.

You will notice a reworked HUD (Heads-Up-Display) where it is easier to check your hit points and current score.

Fellow Shamans are also getting a beautiful 90Hz refresh rate on Quest 2.

Be on the lookout for 15 new moons.

The tutorial has been entirely reworked thanks to your feedback. You will see it is shorter and more fluid to move through. It also emphasizes the use of both hands as using the shield is key to your success. You will notice how parrying an incoming projectile now translates into an additional charge on your attack wand!

Your space traveling has sped up! The tunnels are shorter from planet to planet making your time traveling through space more dynamic.

Every character has its own distinct voice, and our favorite mentor Heidi is now speaking English when the Astral Teleporter allows it.

Finally, fellow Shamans speaking Spanish, Italian, Japanese or Chinese can join in on the fun. That’s 7 languages supported!

Now go, Shaman.
The Universe is counting on you!

node.reviewDescription:
The game is already really well fleshed out, well worth the current price. The casting mechanic is super intuitive and after a few minutes you can get pretty quick with it. The music is pretty fun too and it really adds to the experience. It has massive potential, but needs a few changes and some more content. It’s also really nice to see the devs updating it, support is always a bonus.

I have a few changes that could help improve it a bit: there should be a setting to keep the battle music playing constantly like a radio. I love the music, but I almost never get a chance to fully enjoy a track before I beat a level and I’d like to maintain the energetic pacing. There should also be a list of current spells or modifiers equiped when you pause the game, it wouldn’t really benefit much in game but it would help remember what you have during a run if you ever take a break. It would also be cool if there was a mode where you fight against waves of enemies and you obtain new spells over time as a sort of endless mode, though that’s a completely different play style. There’s also a few bugs that induce lag, such as any spells that attack automatically being multiplied repeatedly. The daemon has this problem sometimes. The sword spell also seems to be a little inconsistent on what counts as a hit, though I might just not be great with it. Other than that the game is pretty well optimized. It is very pleasing to the eyes and well thought out and super easy to sink a lot of time into. I’m excited to see what the devs do with it next!

website_page_meta.description:
Become a STAR SHAMAN and embark on an epic adventure to bring the funk of life back into a universe whose existence has been depleted to boring cubes by the Architects of Entropy. Travel through enchanting, futuristic galaxies to funky french-touch music.

STAR SHAMAN is an active VR adventure with touches of roguelite.
website_page_meta.title: Star Shaman · Oculus Quest
